SEARCH
Package me.yleoft.zAPI.handlers

Class PlaceholderDefinition

java.lang.Object
me.yleoft.zAPI.handlers.PlaceholderDefinition
public class PlaceholderDefinition extends Object
Represents a single placeholder entry for MiniPlaceholders registration.

This defines a key that will be registered as a MiniPlaceholders tag, along with how many colon-separated arguments it expects and what type of placeholder it is.

Example definitions and their resulting usage:

  • ("version", 0, GLOBAL) → <zhomes_version> (no audience needed)
  • ("home", 1, AUDIENCE) → <zhomes_home:1> (uses viewing player)
  • ("home_world", 1, AUDIENCE) → <zhomes_home_world:1>
  • ("home", 1, PLAYER_TARGETED) → <zhomes_home:Steve:1> (targets "Steve")
  • ("has_home", 1, PLAYER_TARGETED) → <zhomes_has_home:Steve:base>

For PlaceholderType.PLAYER_TARGETED, the parameterCount does not include the player-name argument — that is prepended automatically. So if you define ("home", 1, PLAYER_TARGETED), usage is <zhomes_home:Steve:1> (player + 1 param).

      public PlaceholderDefinition(@NotNull @NotNull String key, int parameterCount, @NotNull @NotNull PlaceholderType type)

      Parameters:
      key - The placeholder key (e.g., "home_name", "home_world")
      parameterCount - The number of colon-separated arguments this placeholder expects (excluding the player-name arg for PLAYER_TARGETED)
      type - The placeholder type
